response.name: oxygen
response.feedback: Correct. The human body requires oxygen from the air to convert nutrients to energy through cellular respiration.

response.name: carbon dioxide
response.feedback: Incorrect. The human body produces carbon dioxide as waste product. It does not need to obtain it from the air.

response.name: nutrients
response.feedback: Correct. Oxygen is required to convert nutrients such as glucose into energy that cells can utilize.

response.name: energy
response.feedback: Incorrect. The oxygen from the air will be used to convert nutrients such as glucose into energy such as ATP that cells can use.
